newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil state sees orange crop of 381.8 mln boxes.
newsitem.headline: Brazil state sees orange crop of 381.8 mln boxes.

text.p: The Brazilian state of Sao Paulo should see an orange crop of 381.8 million 40.8-kg boxes in 1997/98 (July/June), said the director of the state Agricultural Economics Institute (IEA).
The estimate follows a field survey in February and compares with a 1996/97 crop of around 355 million boxes, said Antonio Ambrosio.
Of the 1996/97 harvest, around 270 million boxes were processed for orange juice and this level is expected to be virtually unchanged in 1997/98, he added.

Brazilian Association of Citrus Exporters (Abecitrus) is to make its first estimate of the 1997/98 crop on May 20. Its forecast does not include all of Sao Paulo state but also covers some production in Minas Gerais and so tends to be a little larger than IEA estimates, the Abecitrus president said recently.
The IEA should have a new forecast for 1997/98 at beginning of May, Ambrosio said. ((-Caroline Bulloch, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 5074151))
